title: Don't you love it when you're playing your main...
body: ....and people counterpick you so often that you're better at dealing with the counterpicks than normal lanes.

replies.body:
The fun thing is when people look up what the best counter for your champion is, don't really know how to play that champion, but pick it anyway because counterpicks win games, right?  ....  right?


I remember I used to play a lot of Ahri, and would always end up against people who would pick Ryze against me, because it was the top-listed counter on all the counter sites at the time (this was before either of their reworks), yet I almost never lost against a Ryze because I knew how to play the matchup and they usually didn't.

Just checked Xerath's counters and guess who pops up first: Ahri.  So that explains why everyone picks Ahri into my Xerath, even though a Xerath player with decent experience in the matchup will make Ahri's life a living hell.
My ahri will eat your xerath.

Similarly, I can pick Cho mid lane and be confident I have the potential to win any match-up, even harder ones like Cass or Brand.

I've heard that too- I have no idea why Teemo is supposed to counter Darius.

A friend of mine (alas, he's bronze) was having such a fit against a Teemo as Darius. I eventually had to have a talk with him, 
"Bro, does his blind work on your Q?"

'...no.'

The match-up is different from most Darius match-ups. I usually go offensive masteries, but against Teemo I run 9/21/0 to better withstand his harass. I take teleport rather than ignite, since it's safer and Teemo is one champion I honestly don't feel is durable enough to warrant the ignite. The key to winning the lane is movement speed.

Tier one boots and a phage make Teemo so much simpler.

Kill a minion, then dash to him and E, then immediately W rather than canceling your AA animation. This way you can get the extra damage on him without being blinded. Auto the shit out of him and chase, Q when he gets to the outer rim. If he's dunkable, do it. Once you kill Teemo it becomes very easy to do so again. If you're not camped, I find Teemo to be a fairly simple match for Darius. Not the easiest, but I've never lost it.

The really great thing about this match is that Darius is honestly more useful in a team fight than Teemo IMO, unless the Teemo's team forces a fight in a mushroom field. He doesn't even get to outscale you.

I've had similar cases as Garen I think. I remember being told that Teemo counters him (don't really know if this is true) and after a bad early game where I play fairly passively (I try to live and farm, in that order) eventually I reach a point where I am too tanky for Teemo's shit and DEMACIA him to death. It's fun.

Yasuo Counters Anivia in lane.... Meanwhile I always win against him...
Yasuo doesn't even remotely counter Anivia in lane to begin with... Anivia beats all melees in lane, period.

No im pretty sure Yasuo counters her, and she beats all Assassins in lane, not melee. Anivia is pure ranged, and her strongest attacks travel very slowly. yasuo's wall allows him to easily avoid them because of this.

She beats all both. Melees are very easy to land Qs on while theyre attempting to CS, and you also can abuse your auto range for harass. Assassins can't all in her due to Q+E and wall, not to mention egg.

 Yasuo's wall is much longer cooldown than anivia's Q or E, and is highly glitchy- her E will often go right through it, depending on timing. Pre 6 you simply abuse your high auto attack range to get last hits safely. If he attempts to engage anyway, it's pretty easy to double tap q for stun prior to the projectile passing through the wall. Follow up with an easy E, either right away if he didn't get the wall off or just after walking through the wall during the stun. Grats, there goes half his health.

Post 6, things are dramatically easier. Just E>R then back off. He'll wall it; that's fine. Wait for your E, then E>R again, the wall won't be off cd. There goes 1/4 his hp. 

I've played this matchup a lot- the very best of yasuos have some potential to make plays in it, especially if you underestimate them. Most, however, just sort of die.
